eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.container

Class HCPGridContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.container.HCPGridContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HCPElement

    public class HCPGridContainer
extends Object
implements HCPElement
    Paints a 2-dimensional grid of HCPElements. Rows and columns are laid out independently and different HCPLayouts can be used for rows and columns.The maximum width of all elements in a column is used as the width of the column. The maximum height of all elements in a row is used as the height of the row.

    The elements are painted in rows from left to right and rows are painted from top to bottom.

    This class is immutable.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • HCPGridContainer

        public HCPGridContainer(HCPLayout layout,
                        HCPElement[][] elements)
        Creates an HCPGridContainer with a single HCPLayout for rows and columns.

        Elements is an array of row arrays. The first array corresponds to the top-most row and the last array to the bottom-most row. Each row array contains the elements of the row from left to right.

        An empty elements array as well as an elements array containing only empty row arrays are allowed, however the resulting container behaves like an empty element (see HCPEmpty).

        Parameters:
        layout - not null
        elements - not null; all row arrays must not be null, must have the same length and must not contain null elements themselves
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if layout or elements is null
        NullPointerException - if elements contains a null row array or a row array contains a null element
        IllegalArgumentException - if a row array has the wrong length

      • HCPGridContainer

        public HCPGridContainer(HCPLayout horizontalLayout,
                        HCPLayout verticalLayout,
                        HCPElement[][] elements)
        Creates an HCPGridContainer with separate horizontal and vertical layouts.

        Elements is an array of row arrays. The first array corresponds to the top-most row and the last array to the bottom-most row. Each row array contains the elements of the row from left to right.

        An empty elements array as well as an elements array containing only empty row arrays are allowed, however the resulting container behaves like an empty element (see HCPEmpty).

        Parameters:
        horizontalLayout - used to lay out columns; not null
        verticalLayout - used to lay out rows; not null
        elements - not null; all row arrays must not be null, must have the same length and must not contain null elements themselves
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if horizontalLayout, verticalLayout or elements is null
        NullPointerException - if elements contains a null row array or a row array contains a null element
        IllegalArgumentException - if a row array has the wrong length

      • paint

        public void paint(PDPageContentStream content,
                  PDRectangle shape)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: HCPElement
        Paints this element to the specified PDPageContentStream.

        Shape defines the position and size which should be used for painting. If the size is less than specified by HCPElement.getWidth() and HCPElement.getHeight() then this method does not guarantee that (a) the requested size is used or (b) the element is painted correctly or (c) the element is painted at all.

        Specified by:
        paint in interface HCPElement
        Parameters:
        content - not null
        shape - not null
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error writing to the stream
